page.title: 14THE HERRING'S DAY CONTINUED
page.content: During the morning at school I have a swimming lesson, I recently passed my Bronze medallion for survival swimming. Later on in the morning we have a maths lesson and I work hard at mental maths work. At 12.15pm we have our lunch hour and the children have either sandwiches or a school meal. After lunch my mother writes out the theatre list for Mr.Jones,the surgeon. The list contains the name of the patient, the time of the operation, what they are having done, and the number of the operating theatre. Afternoons in school can include guitar lessons, games, computer work or art work. School finishes at 3.30pm and I walk home and let out Penny our dog. Mum arrives home at 5.15pm. I usually watch T.V. until mum comes home, I then have tea and go to bed at 9.15pm.{Written by Paul Herring.
